audio_caption: The audio clip begins with an instrumental piece featuring a soft and melancholic tone, played on what sounds like a stringed instrument, possibly a ukulele or a small guitar. Background ambient noise is present, but minimal. Following this, a male speaker introduces himself as an evolutionary astrologer, beginning with "Hello everybody, I'm Boris Pfiler, and I'm here with the evolutionary astrology message..." A second male speaker, with a lower voice, then pronounces a name, sounding like an acknowledgement of introduction from Boris.

A male speaker starts by discussing a transformative time that astrologers have been speaking about, and mentions this has been covered in his videos as well. He refers to a "title wave" that will take people where they need to go, and suggests giving in to this wave. He advises against moving too fast or becoming too individualistic or obsessive with one's own ideas. The speech has a conversational and somewhat excited tone.

The audio clip features one male speaker with a conversational tone discussing the need to "row fast enough" to avoid being "left in the desert of yesterday" and the importance of believing in change. This speech is interspersed with a musical track, likely ambient or background music, creating a contemplative mood. The speaker continues, describing that change occurs "not when I want it but when somebody else brings it up into my life".

The audio clip begins with one male speaker discussing the current time and its tendency to "drag out from the ends of our sewers" everything that people have been trying to forget, bringing it to the surface. His tone is somewhat dramatic, emphasizing the gravity of the situation. He continues by saying "our shadows are dancing in broad daylight right now."

The audio clip starts with a single male speaker who, in a calm and somewhat motivational tone, states "So hang in there." He emphasizes that things will become "more intense" until January, peak time, and continue until March 2020, describing it as a marathon rather than a sprint. The speaker continues, advising listeners to keep their "heart rate and breathing steady." The audio transitions, and the speaker states, "The energies are going to intensify."

The clip begins with a male speaker discussing that "Tuesday is peak time" with a somewhat serious and deliberate tone, highlighting themes of intensity and challenge. He then encourages the listener that "'it ain't over until the fat lady sings'" and that they are still in the midst of the storm.

A male speaker discusses Mars, Ares, Pluto, and the god of the underworld. He talks about "squaring," a conflictual and challenging aspect, and mentions emotional drama, anger, and rage. The speaker's tone is informative and descriptive.

The clip features a single male speaker expressing concern about the current time, characterizing it as notoriously cruel, too intense, aggressive, and revengeful. He emphasizes the need to watch out for these traits in our personal lives and warns against potential tragedies like terrorist attacks, armed conflicts, and other unspecified events. The speaker's tone is serious and cautionary. The clip ends abruptly without any music or background sounds.

The clip begins with a male speaker describing the present time as "volatile", advising listeners to "enhance your calm". He cautions against overreacting and making "mountains out of mole hills". He notes this intensity peaks on Tuesday but lessens towards the end of the week. The speaker has a calm and reassuring tone. Throughout the speech, there is background noise suggestive of the outdoors, with the subtle sounds of wind chimes providing a tranquil ambience.

The audio clip begins with a single speaker discussing that Thursday, Friday, and Saturday appear calmer. He states that things may "start winding down a little bit" and that the sun sextiles Saturn, bringing stability, consistency, and consensus. The speaker has a positive and calm tone. Lastly, he mentions holding things a little in a good way.

The clip begins with a male speaker talking in a casual and informative tone about astrological aspects, noting, "the sun then trines Neptune which is a great time to talk to the muses," encouraging artistic and creative expression. He emphasizes nature's healing properties and suggests a slower, tranquil pace for work. The speaker is discussing "Saturn sextiling Neptune a day later." The clip ends with a simple, "So, that's about it."

The audio clip starts with a male speaker promoting astrology classes and personalized consultations. His tone is friendly and encouraging. He thanks his listeners for sharing and commenting on his content, suggesting community interaction. He ends by wishing listeners a long and prosperous life. Transitioning from this message, the clip features instrumental music, with a mellow and slightly melancholic tone. A guitar plays the main melody.
